New Records: South Africa's Gerald Coetzee celebrated the dismissal of England's Harry Brook
Klaasen hit 12 fours and four sixes in all
Klaasen hit his first World Cup hundred, and fourth overall, and it was the second quickest hundred in this tournament
South Africa scored 399-7, the second-highest total in the tournament
Key Match Events: England plunged to 38-4 after 8.1 overs in their reply
Klaasen and Jansen toyed with England's pace and spin to put on 151
Klaasen and Jansen helped South Africa plunder 143 runs in the last 10 overs in an incredible display of power hitting
Jonny Bairstow holed out for 10 off Lungi Ngidi
Dawid Malan was caught behind off Jansen
Joe Root hit the ball straight off his pads to the leg gully for a simple practice catch
Ben Stokes (5) offered a simple return catch to Kagiso Rabada
Gerald Coetzee sent back skipper Jos Buttler (15) and Harry Brook (17) in the 12th over
Post-Match Reflections: England's skipper Jos Buttler admitting, 'It leaves us with no room for error.'
We probably have to win every other game we play from here on, and that's the situation we're in.'
Miscellaneous Highlights: South Africa bounced back from their own surprising loss – to the Netherlands on Tuesday
The conditions were brutal. It’s proper heat and saps the energy out of you.
Sri Lanka finally got their first win by beating the Netherlands by five wickets in Lucknow, India
Others: South Africa's big win cements their third spot with six points
England sank to ninth in the table, tied on two points with last-place Afghanistan
